entry.title: Article of Awesome
entry.content:
Although school is important, it can get quite long and repetitive sometimes. It’s the same classes every other day for 10 months straight, so we tend to get stuck in a boring routine: school, homework, sleep, repeat. It's difficult to find pleasure in the school stuff we do, so we turn to other things, like entertainment, media, sports, and the arts. So, while you’re sitting in whatever class right now, here are 15 awesome everyday things to think about. I hope they may cheer you up, or make your outlook on life a little more positive, without the feelings of stress, anxiety and craziness.

  1. Sleeping in a bed with fresh sheets

  2. Looking in the fridge/pantry and seeing your favourite snack

  3. The feeling of a soft rug under your bare feet

  4. The buzz after you’ve just posted a new picture on social media, and

    see the positive comments start rolling in

  5. The smell of freshly baked cookies

  6. Finishing that thing you’ve been procrastinating about for a long

    time

  7. Naturally waking up early, without an alarm

  8. Finally eating the food you’ve been craving forever

  9. When someone asks, “How was your day?” and you actually have

    good/eventful news to share

  10. Having a good hair day

  11. Cracking a joke and making everyone laugh

  12. When you randomly reach out to a friend to see if they’re free and

    they are

  13. The movie theatre lights dimming, letting you know that the magic is

    about to begin

  14. Being the one in your friend group who actually remembered the

    homework

  15. The feeling of walking out of school on a Friday

There you have it! Just a few ordinary things that may make you smile, or fill you with satisfaction. I hope these things give you the motivation to conquer your day and remind you that there’s a lot to enjoy in the world, so keep a lookout!

entry.title: Autumn Activities That Will Leaf A Smile On Your Face

link.title: Autumn Activities That Will Leaf A Smile On Your Face

entry.content:
Oh my gourd, autumn is here! Beleaf me when I say this is going to be the best autumn ever! Don’t like autumn? Don’t be hay-tin on this season! Here are some things you can do in Toronto to get into the holiday (oops, too soon…) fall spirit!

  1. Autumn Treats!

Start with a warm drink, probably something from Tim’s (not sponsored, but they should consider it!). It doesn’t have to be a pumpkin spice latte (but it could). Hot chocolates and French vanillas are some solid options too! This season also gives us a lot of maple and caramel flavoured drinks. Maybe you’re more of an apple cider person? As for food, well, I love me some apple pie!

  1. Experience Nature!

Yes, everything is indeed dying. And yes, the wise birds are leaving before the disaster known as winter in Canada strikes. But that doesn’t mean we can’t enjoy the beauty of the season! Go for a hike on one of Toronto’s many trails, take in the view, get that Insta shot! #AutumnVibes

Alternatively, go apple picking or select the best pumpkin in the patch!

  • Sincerely,

The Pumpkin Patch Kids™

  1. Corn Mazes!

I’ve never done one myself but HOLY HECK does it look like a blast!!! If you’re looking for one, Downey’s Farm has an 8km corn maze! Hit me up if you’re down! ;)

  1. Halloween Events!

You might be feeling too old or if you’re like me (too lazy) to go trick or treating but don’t worry! There are plenty of other events that’ll send shivers down your spine. Get scared this season (and not just in an ‘I have 20 assignments and it’s 2am’ sort of way)!

There's Canada's Wonderland Halloween Haunt, Halloween on Church Street on the 31st, Screemers down at the CNE or one of several zombie walks and haunted houses. You could also catch a horror flick if you aren’t a total chicken like me…

  1. Cheer on the Raptors!

Minus Kawhi Leonard.

Additional Pro Tips!!!

•Catch the good times, not a cold!

•Crunch on some crrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrispy leaves!

•Stay cozy! Much love, MCI!
